text.title: Variants per Gene per database version
text.short: Attempts to capture gene-level changes in the database over Release dates
text.long: Each bubble is one gene. The Y-axis and bubble size represent the number of variants. Thus, genes with more annotated variants 'float' to the top. The X-axis is the number of distinct phenotypes on a Logarithmic scale. The colour of the bubble indicates the most common interpretation of variants for a given gene.

metadata.author: Bret Heale
metadata.notes: TSV is based on aggregation of release dates. For each release date the 100 genes with the most variants is reported. NOTE: Release Date and Submission dates are different. Future releases can have variants with submissions that even pre-date ClinVar itself. So, this graph and the HistoryGraph and QuickStats graph only agree on the most current version data.
